meanings.definition: Put (someone or something) into a situation in which there is a danger of loss, harm, or failure.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the door unlocked jeopardised the safety of the house.
meanings.sent2: The reckless behavior jeopardised the success of the project.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to bring an umbrella jeopardised my dry clothes.
meanings.sent4: His impulsive decisions jeopardised his reputation at work.
meanings.sent5: The icy road conditions jeopardised our journey home.

meanings.sent1: Not wearing a helmet while biking jeopardised his head safety.
meanings.sent2: The stormy weather jeopardised the outdoor event.
meanings.sent3: Eating spicy food late at night jeopardised his peaceful sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her procrastination jeopardised her chances of getting a good grade.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise jeopardised the fragile glassware.
